thread.title: Kieren Jack captain, Charlotte Goodlet: Family issues irrelevant in stepping down as Sydney Swans skipper
thread.title_full: Kieren Jack captain, Charlotte Goodlet: Family issues irrelevant in stepping down as Sydney Swans skipper

title: Kieren Jack captain, Charlotte Goodlet: Family issues irrelevant in stepping down as Sydney Swans skipper
text:
TIM WATSON’S AWKWARD BUDDY WEDDING MOMENT 
“I think we’ve probably also got the philosophy at the club of continuing to look ahead of the curb,” Jack told Fox Sports News 500 . 
“I got a role when Adam Goodes stepped down. He stepped down when he was still playing good footy and we’d just won a premiership. So they’re the things we look for at the club. 
“I think to elevate three vice captains — Dane Rampe, Dan Han, Luke Parker — just gives our leadership model a restructure and I think can only be positive for the football club.” Kieren Jack will remain in the Swans’ leadership group. Photo: Mark Nolan/Getty Images Source: Getty Images 
Despite stepping down from the captaincy, Jack said he and McVeigh would continue to play important leadership roles at the Swans. 
In particular, Jack indicated he was looking forward to working with some of the club’s emerging midfielders. 
“Being an older head in the team I’ll be able to spend some more time with the younger guys and help them come through and develop a little more,” he said. 
“I look at Isaac Heeney and Zak Jones and Callum Mills, who I really want to be a part of the midfield in the future, so (it’s about) helping them along the way.” 
With Jack poised to spend less time in the Swans’ engine room to help fast track the development of the aforementioned, he said he was relishing the prospect of playing forward. 
Jack kicked 27 majors in Sydney’s 2012 premiership year, as well as 24 the following season. 
“You look at some of the players we’ve got down there like Kurt Tippett and (Lance Franklin). If I’m a small down there at their feet I should get a fair few opportunities,” Jack said.
